review: i have had it only had it for a couple of days but it looks good it is fast it charges from the usb port the screen is bright for the money you can not beat it.

Before you read any further, consider the price of this tablet and then think about what you want a tablet to do. You would not be buying an iPad quality tablet, but you would be getting a big screen Android tablet at a budget price with room to add storage for music, movies and photos. (Note - micro SD card and micro USB flash drives are not included, nor is a Bluetooth speaker as shown in the video.) ---------------- WHAT I WANT IN AN ANDROID TABLET I want a 10" Android tablet for watching YouTube, Netflix and Hulu Plus. I also want to check email, surf my favorite websites (Facebook, SavvySleuth, Pinterest, Amazon...) and take photos and videos. I want it to connect easily to any available WiFi network, have the ability to increase its storage capacity and have a decent (2-3 hour) battery life on a single charge. This Dragon Touch AIX-Plus can do most of this, with a few things that could be improved upon. The biggest issues I have with this tablet and the reason I don't give it a perfect 5-star review relate to its cameras, connectivity, inflated promises (GPS...not so much) and fair battery life. Let me explain. ------------------ THE "PLUS" There is another AIX tablet from Dragon Touch on Amazon, but it doesn't have `Plus' in the title. What's the Plus to this one? The `Plus' means it has FM radio. I had to email the seller to figure this one out because at when I received this item from the seller to review it, there was no product info on their website. (They've got it up now, but it's really not very comprehensive so email them with direct questions.) To access the FM radio you have to have a wired headset connected to the tablet. (Something like this will do it: Sony MDR-ZX100-BLK Stereo Wired Headphones Over-the-ear Lightweight Collapsible with Neodymium Magnets & 30mm Drivers, 3.5mm Plug, 1.2m cord, and Adjustable Headband (Black) ZX Series - {Brown Box Packaging}. The FM receiver in the tablet uses the wire in the headphones as an antenna. I found this to be a unique feature, but not one that most users who have WiFi will use at all. It would be useful if you were in a no-internet zone and wanted to listen to music though, and didn't plan on moving around a lot as that can affect FM reception. ---------------------- TABLET FEATURES & USE The build quality of this tablet is better than most at this low price, yet the ability to gently move my finger on the back of the case and still see movement on the screen is disappointing. (A firm case is needed to protect this tablet, but I think that's the case with all of them.) The screen is bright and sharp. Images look good, as does video, however viewing angles are very important. Direct line viewing is best. If you get just a little off to the side, the screen appears dark. ----------- The sound is good too, and enhanced via a Bluetooth connection which is easy to setup in the Settings on the tablet. I liked using a Bluetooth speaker with it to watch YouTube videos, and I tried it with Bluetooth headphones and it worked great. (This tablet can also use Bluetooth keyboards.) These are products I'd suggest if you don't already have Bluetooth accessories that'll work: Hype Pyramid 10 W Speaker Stainless Steel Ultra-portable Wireless Rechargeable Bluetooth 3D Stereo Speaker, Powerful Sound with Built in Microphone, for iPhone 6 Plus + 5s 5c 5 4s, iPad 4 3 2 Retina Air Mini, iPod Touch, Samsung Galaxy s5 s4 s3, Note, ... - works great, as do these earbuds; Jarv NMotion Sport Wireless Bluetooth 4.0 Stereo Earbuds/Headphones with In-Line Microphone , Red. ------------ The `GPS' feature isn't really a GPS. There is Location services in Settings which can be enabled and used with Google Maps, if you are connected via Wi-Fi. There is no cellular data connection possible with this tablet, nor no stand-alone GPS feature, so I think this is an overstatement in the product description. Per TabletExpress - their explanation of what the GPS feature is was sent to me in an email on 1/29/15: "GPS can only use in outdoors. You can please go to "Settings"--"personal" and tap "Location, then you'll find there're some mode you can choose. Also you can download apps such as "GPS Test" to test if there has GPS in your area. Some map apps may help you when there's no wifi if you've download offline maps." I stand by my assessment - 'NO' real GPS feature is on this tablet. I went to Settings - Location - and turned on Location Services (which is only accessible via Wifi). Outside without Wifi - no GPS no matter what settings are on or off. ------------- The cameras are not this tablet's best feature. Neither the forward facing nor the rear facing cameras are what I would consider good. Neither has high enough resolution to take sharp photos or video. Photos I took were grainy and video was mediocre, but this does speak to the price and manufacturers have to cut corners somewhere! Both cameras are located on the tablet housing in spots that if you happen to be holding the tablet in portrait mode with the ports at the top, you can't easily touch the shutter button as it's at the top of your screen. If you use the camera with the shutter button at the bottom of the screen - you cover the camera! Thus, the only real way to take photos or video is with the tablet in landscape orientation. It's a user-interface issue that could potentially be fixed in later firmware updates. ------------ A really nice feature of this tablet is that you can easily expand the capacity from 16GB (works out to be 13GB after the OS and pre-loaded apps) to much more via micro SD (up to a 32GB card per the manufacturer) and a USB flash drive connected via micro USB. I used one like this: SanDisk Ultra 32GB Micro USB 2.0 OTG Flash Drive For Android Smartphone/Tablet With App- SDDD-032G-G46. I was able to view photos and play video from a USB flash drive via a micro USB connection, but the tablet did have an issue not being able to read a .WMA music file (Windows Music File) and play it. It does pay .MP3 files just fine. -------------------- Wi-Fi connectivity is how this tablet gets the internet. It's usually very easy to connect a tablet by finding the wireless network you want to connect to, then entering a password. I did that, but the tablet kept dropping the signal saying `problems authenticating'. I decided to use an alternative method. I used the WPS security button on my router with the setting on the tablet. The two paired easily and maintained the connection after doing it this way. ----------------- CONCLUSION This is a good, budget 10.1" Android tablet. It has a quick quad core 1.3Ghz processor with a 1074 x 600 resolution multi-touch screen. The screen is fairly responsive, and the tablet has enough memory (1GB) to stream media without a problem. The cameras are not great, and the housing does have some flex to it, speaking to a budget-build quality. Connecting to WiFi wasn't effortless, there's no true GPS (as stated in the product description on Amazon) and the FM radio is the only "plus" per the manufacturer. I like that it has so many ways to expand its storage (both micro SD up to 32GB and via a micro USB flash drive) which means you can bring your photos, music and videos with you on the road to view on your tablet or share on a monitor or HDTV via a micro HDMI to HDMI connection (cable not included) - one like this: BlueRigger High Speed Micro HDMI to HDMI cable with Ethernet (6 Feet). Being a cord cutter (not using cable TV) and using streaming media on my HDTV to supplement my over air free TV, I use things like this a lot. NOTE: If you want to know how to cut the cord, check out my book: Simple Guide to Over-the-Air Free TV. The battery life is not great, but adequate for a tablet its size. About 2-3 hours with intermittent stand-by and basic email and internet surfing. If you are streaming video, about 45 minutes to 1 hour. (You can extend this by picking up an external battery backup like this: RAVPower 3rd Gen Deluxe 13000mAh External Battery Portable Dual USB Charger 4.5A Output Power Bank. iSmart(tm) Broad Compatibility, Fast Charging, High Capacity, Ultra Compact. For iPhone 6 6 plus 5S 5C 5 4S, iPad Air mini (Apple 30pin and Lightning Cab... and connecting the tablet to it when you are watching videos.) -------------- Regarding charging... There is a clear film that's on the screen when you get the tablet, with some writing that says 'charge battery 10 hours prior to first use'. This is unnecessary per TabletExpress, although I did it anyway. There's also an error in the directions about how to charge the tablet with the included 5V charger. There is no 5V (pin-type) charger included, but there is a USB to micro USB cable and a micro USB to AC wall charger included. Both work to charge the device. 1/29/15 - Per email from TabletExpress - the directions are wrong and will be changed in the future to reflect the accurate way to charge this device. ---------- Overall, it's a good choice for those who want a bigger screen and don't want to pay a hefty price. There are lots of free Google Play apps (sign up on the tablet for a Gmail account or use an exisitng one) you can add to this tablet for gaming, media streaming, and productivity. You can also easily add a Bluetooth keyboard case to make this tablet even more useful on the go. The bottom line: It's not a high-end tablet, but many will be happy with it. The company appears to want to uphold good customer service with phone number and email contacts available, and a 1 year warranty on the tablet. --------------------------- NOTE: I received this product from TabletExpress in exchange for my honest review. The company does include an offer for a FREE GIFT in the tablet's box, which asks that purchasers review the item and send a copy of their review to the company to receive a free protective case. ---------------------------- UPDATE: 1/29/15 - Email from TabletExpress I was originally contacted by TabletExpress to review this tablet (about 10 days ago...) and asked that I write my review and then send it to them for their approval prior to posting. I wrote back to them: "I understand you would like to have perfect 5 star ratings on your reviews to sell more tablets, however I will not agree to send you my review before posting nor will I agree not to post it if it's less than 4 stars. I write my reviews to help other Amazon shoppers to purchase items that will fit their needs. I write reviews on products I purchase, some received from the Amazon Vine review program, and some products from sellers who request reviews as you did. I do them all the same way in an attempt to be as objective, fair and honest as possible about the product and my experience with the company that sells it. I will understand if you do not want to send me your item for review." They surprised me and wrote back saying that was OK and they'd send me the tablet anyway, with a protective keyboard case; asking that I review that as well: Tabsuit PU Leather Keyboard Case Cover Stand for Dragon Touch 10.1'' A1X/A1/R10X and more Android Tablet. The seller told me they had confidence in their product and looked forward to the review. -------------------- As promised I reviewed this item honestly and fairly. However today I received an email from TabletExpress asking me to remove certain parts of this review that they didn't agree with or didn't want mentioned. I added their explanation of 'GPS' and their promise to fix the included directions which have improper charging instructions. There was a request to remove a certain portion of the review, which I did not because it is honest and part of my experience with the product. The product is not perfect, but I believe my assessment of it is fair and honest. I've shown the product in the video, and discussed its features to the best of my ability. It's good for the price, and I trust that Amazon shoppers will be able to figure out if it's right for them or not, as long as they still have an honest review to consider before they buy.

When that didn't work, I gave them all the info they needed to send me software to hopefully fix the problem.  Included was a copy-and-paste of the Amazon order number.  When what the told me to do that time didn't work, I contacted them again.  At that point in time, all of a sudden, they couldn't find the order number, and needed proof of where I'd bought it and when.  Bottom line, the tablet is nice for the price, but forget the company helping you out.  They don't care.

My family got this tablet as a holiday gift, and we love it. The screen is a great size for both internet searching and video streaming. It is easy to use and has a large variety of apps that you can download. The battery life is great, and I love that it tells you how many minutes left it has to get a full charge while plugged in. As a family full of iPhone users, but having no experience with tablets, we are impressed.

But, there are a few minor downsides, which prompted the four star rating. The screen does not stay on very long, and we are constantly needing to re-click the button to wake up the screen. However, if you do it quick enough, you often don't have to unlock the device again before using, which is nice. The second downside is that the screen is really not all that sensitive and sometimes requires you to do the same action multiple times before it recognizes it. And lastly, it can be a little hard to see the screen if you are not looking at it directly head on, which doesn't cause much trouble unless multiple people are trying to see the screen at once.

Overall I think my whole family would recommend this device to someone looking for a tablet, but not wanting to spend an exuberant amount of money.

I got this for my brother for his birthday back in August 2015 (I'm writing this review in January 2016). After just 6 months of use the buttons for the volume are sunk in and you have to use your fingernail to get them to work. The power button is unresponsive at times and I have a hard time getting the screen to wake up when he wants to use it. The screen is plastic that will scratch with anything harder than a fingernail (including fingernails, as they scratch the screen easily as well).

Warranty is misleading stating a full 1 year. Turns out the warranty is 1 year for software and 90 days for hardware.

I would never recommend this product nor would I ever buy it again. I've learned my lesson and regret not going with a name brand after all. I just thought I would get a bigger screen for the same price as a Samsung and get more for my dollar. Do not buy this product unless you plan on throwing away your money in less than 1 year.

We received these on a Tuesday afternoon (My husband and I both have one).  Initially opening them, I was prepared to plug them in and let them charge.  Surprisingly enough, They were over 75% charged at first time boot up.  Side by side, entering each of our information and getting them ready for first use:  While my husband was at work- I had a good portion of the day to "dork around" with mine.  In the beginning- it was great, simple for the seasoned "Android" phone/tablet user.  Mine had a small "glitch" of sorts and not the cute kinda glitch from Wreck It Ralph :)  While my husband had two home screens to swipe left and right from.. Mine only had one..  My first thought was "I'm not gonna deal with this right outta the gate and wondered what could I exchange it for that was equal"..  I took a moment to skim the User Manual with no success- and in the box, there was a small paper that said "STOP.. Call us before returning product".. So I did.  I called the number given several times and after holding for 7-10 minutes, I got an auto recording that asked me to send an email or call back.. After three attempts of calling them and while on my fourth attempt, I got a call coming in from their support team (so they have caller ID).  Told the representative my issue-- it took a couple of times explaining (different ways) to finally get across my problem.  After we came to agreement on what I was talking about and what he/she thought I meant, I hung up and attempted what was suggested.. THAT WORKED (a 1st tier tech that actually knew how to fix my simple problem the first time around- Thank You).  Moving on..  two days later, I still didn't like the fact that the keyboard didn't have the Swype function.. Guess What-  there's app's for that too :)  Needless to say, this tablet is growing on me, my intended use for this unit was for e-reading and for that purpose- IT'S GREAT..  OK.. my husband- he's a much more simpler individual :)  He simply LOVES his tablet and refuses to consider returning it or exchanging it.. In fact, all his free time is now spent using his tablet..  He has no complaints, he loves the size of the unit and he loves the graphic clarity of the unit.. ((We're both still playing with the camera function and it's quality))..  Another plus for this unit is the ability to assign separate user accounts..  We share our units with our daughter and she's simple smitten that she gets her own profile and doesn't have to swipe through a sea of mommy and daddy's junk app's just to get to her games.  C & L  Kueny/Washington state

Love it!  You can't beat the price.  I recently moved up from a 7" to the 10.1".  I went ahead and did a bundle, keyboard case and a 3 pack of screen protectors.  When I opened the box, the tablet already had a screen protector applied.  It wasn't fully charged but more than enough power in the battery to play with it and do the initial setting on it.  It had a few bubbles on the screen protector, but I'll live with it until it gets bad and then I'll replace it.  It didn't come with extra apps so it was nice.  Previous tablet had more apps that I didn't use.  The response on it is great.  It goes from one app to the next very quickly.
The only down side is the resolution on the screen.  But I have played a movie on it and didn't mind it.  I have my college eBooks on it and have no issue with the text size or resolution.  But for that price, I'll adjust and enjoy it.  The body of it seemed good, but the back was plastic, but again for the price, you can learn to live with it too.  I did buy another cover for it.  The keyboard case was too bulky for what I'm using it for.  I would highly recommend this product.  If and when I'm in the market for another tablet, I will be coming back to buy another one from this manufacturer.

Dragon Touch A1X Plus 10.1" Quad Core Tablet PC Google Android 4.4.2 KitKat, 1GB RAM, 16GB Nand Flash, Built-in Bluetooth GPS, HDMI, Google Play Pre-installed, Dual Camera, 3D Game Supported, 2015 New Model [ by TabletExpress ] I would like to start out by saying Amazon has been more than exceptional with my all my purchases. All my items were either on time or arrived earlier. As for the Dragon Touch A1X Plus 10.1, I had a irritating first time experience using it. The touch screen acted as if it had a mind of it's own and wouldn't cooperate with me. Some areas of the screen would be unresponsive, while other areas the screen would register a few inches away from where my finger was placed on the touch screen. ("Show visual feedback for touches" option was turned on.) Just when I was planning to return the product after an hour or so of using the tablet, I then realized that the more I used the touch screen, the better it behaved. So after a few days of constant use, the touch screen finally worked as intended. Overall performance was decent, there was a little lag here and there while using the tablet. The only other complaint that I have is that the charger cable is too short. I would rate this higher if the touch screen issue haven't happen.

I have owned this tablet for about one month. So far it has worked exactly as advertised.  I purchased this tablet specifically to use as a back up for a marine chartplotter/GPS.  To answer a question I had about this tablet . Yes, it does have a stand alone built in GPS built in so it will work in real time just like a Garmin or Magellan GPS navigation device.  I my case, I downloaded a $50.00 Navionics marine navigation app for use on my boat.  It has worked perfectly so far.  As for the other features of this tablet, it seems to connect to WiFi as advertised and has worked for me as far as surfing the internet, streaming videos from Youtube etc.  The battery lasted about 6 hours on a recent trip using it as a GPS navigation device.  I gave this product 4 stars due to the fact that the charger that was included with the tablet does not seem to work all the time.  My car charger works fine for some reason.  For around $100 this is an excellent purchase for my uses.

I have to say, I was pretty disappointed in this tablet. I got this for my 8-year-old son to keep at grandma's house for Skyping and playing games. We have several tablets floating around in our family and this is the first one that we've had a problem with. My mother has very plush carpeting at her house, and the tablet was sitting on an end table. While vacuuming, my father-in-law bumped the corner of the table. The tablet slid off and landed screen side up on the floor - no bouncing off the corner, just landed flat on the super-soft carpet. The glass layer of the screen underneath the plastic broke literally in half. Now, mind you, the coffee table itself is glass from bottom to top, legs and all. The table, despite being hit with a vacuum, came out unscathed. This flimsy little tablet screen split down the middle and rendered the touch screen useless. Unfortunately, this happened exactly 2 days after Amazon's 30-day return period, so now we have a paperweight. I'd rather just buy a whole new one from a more reputable company where I know I'll get quality, than try to track down a replacement part for this obscure off-brand tablet.

I bought 2 for each one of my kids. They both suffer from the same defect; they do not charge after some time.
After about a week, the first tablet stopped charging. I left it in overnight and the light still did not light up when I plug in the charger.
So I had to return that one which was fine since it was within the first 30 days.
A month later (after the return date) the 2nd one stops charging. It was working fine and the light would come on when I charged it before. But now no light and no charge.
I have multiple miniB usb cables that charge different devices and have tried them all. So it is not the cables, but the tablets.
So now I'm stuck with a brick.

Another complaint would be the screen reflection. If you do not look at it directly in front of the screen at the right angle, you can only see your reflection and not the screen. I have an ASUS tablet also and you can view the screen from any angle and any side. But this one seems to be made from some cheap glass. You have about a 5 degree angle to see the screen. Any other angle will be blurred and only see your reflection. I guess you get what you pay for. I do NOT recommend this tablet.

Well I've had this product for about a month now. I must say it is a pretty good budget tablet. I read all the reviews just as your reading this one and because of the honest reviews I decided to go for it, without regret to my purchase. It does everything I wanted in a tablet; access to all my google app's. My first tablet was a windows tablet and was so disappointed, I might as well have just purchased a lap top, I returned it right away. I haven't been away from my home WiFi access, but I'm pretty sure if there is WiFi I access, there wouldn't been a problem for this tablet it connected with no problem.

Pro's: The touch response is quick. Switching between open screens with the ease of a swipe. The start up is quick and painless. Battery life is awesome! I had the tablet charged in the morning used it off and on all day and my son has been on it  for 4 hours straight and its at 26%. and still going. The volume exceptional. Button placement took some getting use to, but convenient. Every time I wanted turn up or down the volume would accidentally hit the power button and turn the screen off. I have not purchase a TF card for more memory yet, but have already downloaded a couple of app's and so far so good, still a lot of space.

Con's: There is a bit of glare on the screen, especially in well lit area's. You can adjust the brightness, but it doesn't make any difference. Low light the screen has perfect contrast. Discovered through the reviews the tablet comes with a screen protector already on it. I thought it did just cause the cut out around the camera, it can be removed if gently lifted with a safety pin. I do not recommend it, because the screen is easy to be scratched. I do my best to care for my purchases and tried to review the difference in glare on the screen without the protector and dust got on the screen, tried wiping off with a soft screen cloth and the dust scratched the screen lightly, so I put the protector back on. thinking of getting an anti-glare one. The camera is fine, but not the best, I didn't purchase the tablet for pictures, that just ridiculous to me. Get a camera or use your phone.

I did think about returning the tablet because of the glare, and that's about it, because it does do what I am looking for and you can't beat the price, the glare apparently was no big deal compared to the accessibility it gave me by providing me with relief from my phone's tiny screen and dying battery.  In the future I do plan to purchase another tablet, but in the mean time this will do.

When the first tablet arrived I charged it and then pressed the power button. The power button got stuck on the first use and the tablet kept cycling through reboot.

I returned the first tablet through Amazon and got a replacement. The second tablet worked fine for two months until it just shut off, with a charged battery, and would not turn on again. No damage from drops or spills; it just stopped working.

I tried to reset the device charge it for a day and still nothing. So yeah I won't be buying from these guys again.

UPDATE: I got it working. I had to swipe the device and restore it back factory settings. I think a bad install might have triggered my android going into rest mode. I found this article for instructions on troubleshooting. Its quick to mistake a software problem for a hardware issue but if stuff cuts on meaning you see the charge icon but its not refilling or you see an android logo or the dragon touch logo I think its safe to say your hardware is ok and your os install may need to be repaired or recovered.

https://fairphone.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/articles/201654943--Resting-Android-robot-No-Command-Black-screen-on-reboot

I bought this because I'm a college student and carrying my full on laptop was trying to murder me because of my long walk from my car to my classes. I previously had a 7" tablet and first off I didn't realise just how big a difference it would make. In a good way of course. I use Chrome instead of the preloaded browser and find it's faster than the preloaded one. It picks up my home and school wifi really easily and honestly it's good for the simple things I use it for. Because of the size I really suggest getting a keyboard and stand sort of case because it can really have a glare problem (though that is in no way against the tablet itself of course!) Not everything is rainbows. If I were to just carry it around without a case I'm worried I could all but break it in half and the other reviews are right that screen itself could really be better. Mine doesn't have too much of a bubbling problem like some of these seem to so I put a screen protector over it and I'm not worried about it. All and all I'm happy for what I need it for! I'm only put it down to four isn't of five because of the risk the screen can really face in the future.

I like this tablet except for a couple of drawbacks:  the first is that it runs out of juice too quickly.  Unlike the iPad or my Best Buy Insignia tablet [which I loved but my husband sat on and cracked] you can't leave the Dragon in "sleep" mode.  You have to turn it off entirely when it's not in use.

When I have tried to turn it on recently, it's been dead and then when I plug in the battery, I see it's at 0% even though it's technically turned off and I haven't been using it.  So I have figured out that you have to turn it off completely if you want to keep it powered up. I set the sleep mode to turn off after 30 minutes but it still runs out of battery far quicker than any of my other devices.

The second drawback is that the resolution is not as good when watching YouTube.  My iPad and cracked Insignia...did I mention how it got cracked....:) both have crystal clear pictures on YouTube but the Dragon Touch does not.  It does have good resolution with Amazon Prime and Netflix so I don't know why the interface with YouTube isn't that great.

It's great for reading my Kindle books and for watching everything but YouTube.  Another good feature is that it gives you notifications from your Facebook page when you turn it on.  It's a good little tablet [especially for the price] but not as good as my other devices.

For the price it is a pretty powerful device. Works great with coding applications and for educational purposes! Haven't had a chance to explore much else on it, but it still does what is intended for incredibly well. Don't expect it to do everything, but it definitely has it's use for schools.

I am rough on my tablets (I've been through three this year) and I got tired of spending a fortune on an item I'm probably going to drop, sit on, etc. I've had this tablet long enough now to know it's pro's and cons. First let me say I'm not into games so I have no idea how it is for that. What I do use it for it performs it's job admirably. I've noticed a lot of reviewers state that there is no GPS, but there is in fact a GPS sensor. It is a little strange the way you have to turn it on, but it is there. Navigation is one of the primary things I use the tablet for and by using downloadable maps it works great. I have other dedicated GPS receivers as well as smart phones but nothing beats having a nice sized screen. I also use the tablet to wirelessly control my DSLR and once again it does the job flawlessly. The bottom line is, if you want a tablet that does just about anything you may need to do and don't want to shell out the big bucks this tablet should do the trick for you.

This is a dandy inexpensive tablet!  It's a companion and backup for the Google Nexus 10, which I bought for a lot more three years ago.  So far, the Dragon Touch supports the important apps I've got on the other machine.  It's a real bargain.

My only major gripe is that the specs and the the so-called 'user manual' (16 tiny pages of usable info) show a separate charging port, while the machine I received has to be charged thru the mini-USB port.  It seems to charge at an OK rate (2 amp), but you can't charge or power the unit while an OTG cable with a thumb drive is attached to the USB port.  So, if you're transferring files to/from USB storage, the battery drains very quickly.

Another minor spec issue:  The HDMI output port requires a 'mini' HDMI male plug, as opposed to the Nexus, which has a 'micro' HDMI socket.  Don't buy a cable until you get the machine; so you'll be able to fit what you need.

Finally, the Nexus 10 'streams' HD videos from an attached thumb drive thru the HDMI output to a TV without problem, while the Dragon Touch can't keep up, and the video is jittery.  Not a problem if you've got room to copy the video to the Dragon Touch, where it works beautifully, but I'd look for reviews regarding its ability to stream videos from online sites (which I haven't tried).

I bought this for my mother in February.  She has a medical condition that makes it difficult to use a laptop, so a tablet was just the thing.  At first, she was excited about it, and used it frequently.

One day, she called me and said the tablet was displaying all sorts of error messages.  Over the phone, I talked her through a factory reset procedure.  That seemed to cure the tablet's problems for a while, but shortly thereafter, she began having problems with it again until it became unusable.

No problem, I thought.  It clearly says right in the product listing,"Full 1 YEAR defect warranty! You're covered from any manufacturing defects for 1 year from the puchase of your Dragon Touch A1X Plus."

That was part of the reason that I bought the tablet.

I got the tablet back from her (not trivial, since she lives a considerable distance away) and put it through the reset procedure again.  I used the tablet around the house for browsing and watching video.  Within three days, it was again displaying error messages and crashing.

So, I contacted Tablet Express to arrange for service.  They walked me through the reset process again, which this time did nothing.  They then told me they would see what they could do for me and "how much it would cost."

I was confused by this.  I argued that the tablet was under warranty. They responded,

"Our company offer a 30-days refund warranty and a 90-days manufacturer replacement warranty, and a 1 year software defective warranty. Any hardware problem after the 90-days replacement warranty, we can provide you a repair service."

Wow. No mention of any 90 day warranty on the listing.  Go back and check for yourself. Just that sentence touting a one year "FULL" warranty.  I assumed I was covered. I think any reasonable person probably would assume the same.

So now, they are wanting to charge me to repair the tablet that they sold to me with the suggestion that it had a "FULL" one year warranty, because I'm outside of the 90 day warranty that was never mentioned.  And, they made the determination, via email, without ever looking at the tablet, that my problem was not "software related", which would be covered under the warranty.

I haven't yet decided what to do, but Tablet Express certainly has me over a barrel.  The tablet is worthless as it stands, and they're not going to cover repairs.  What choice do I have at this point?  I can't even complain to Amazon because the complaint period has closed.

So, if you're hesitant about buying the Dragon Touch A1X, and that one year warranty is influencing you to take the chance, my advice is to just walk away.  It seems that lots of people got lucky and got a good one, but if you don't, you'll likely be paying out of your own pocket to get it right.

So disappointing when companies have no idea of how customer service should work and engage in deceptive tactics to lure in buyers.

Read my review for Yourtech headphones if you want to see how customer service should be done.

EDIT - 9-30-15 - It pays to complain.  I called Amazon and pointed out the discrepancy between the advertised warranty period and the actual warranty that you get.  They agreed to accept the tablet in return, sent me a shipping label, and will credit my account once it arrives.

The headache that Tablet Express caused me is inexcusable, but kudos to Amazon for saving the day.

I purchased 20 10" Dragon tablets. The tablets are great when it's in working condition, and meets all expectations of such an inexpensive item. The 1st tablet of 20 tablets (trial/test) to check the features and durability of this tablet (2014 model). Great tablet, so I bought 19 additional tablets to be used to train students on a specific on line program, later found out that the 19 tablets are 2015 models. Problem #1 with the 2015 model, the charging system is faulty. When plugging the AC adaptor, the tablet indicates it's charging, and after a few hours some tablets are fully charged, but some tablets DO NOT TURN ON at all. I changed AC adaptors but no power. I held down the power switch for 15-60 seconds, no power. These were suggestions from the selling company. Amazon allowed me to return each malfunctioning tablet for a full refund. But this continued to happen each time the tablets were charged. I'm very cautious and knowledgeable on plugging in the AC adaptors as I been an android person for many years. Problem #2, 4 of 19 (2015 models) would malfunction when powering up each time, the tablets would display a foreign language which appears to be Korean. Per vendor of these tablets, if you hold down the power button and volume button the tablet will reset itself. In addition, once the tablets are outside of the 90 day warranty, the malfunctioning tablets must be sent to the 3rd party seller at your own expense. I believe the source of these ongoing problems are from the charging system within the tablets. DON'T BUY THE 2015 MODELS

It also comes with another USB patch cord for data transferral. I'm pleased with 16G but even more pleased that it is expandable with a card slot. I brought this for my 9 year old daughter it is a great tablet. The features and quality is great. Well worth the price. She Loves it!

I ready all of the reviews, including the one stars reviews but still went with this tablet after doing extensive research.

Processor for this tablet is great, internet is fast and videos don't sit and buffer. Games load easily...no issues here.
BATTERY - I didn't have high expectations but the battery has kept a great charge; I bought a 15ft HDMI cord thinking I would need to leave it plugged into the wall while putting movies on my TV...I streamed 2, two hour movies (4 hours in a row unplugged) and still had 50% battery left. Mind you, I charge my Dragon Touch every night when I go to bed.
KID FRIENDLY - I have a 9 and 12 year old, the 9 year old complains that the tablet is too big for her to hold and play games well but she still plays on it all the time :)
SCREEN - The angle viewing was my fear when I purchased this tablet. Here's what you need to know - It has a great angle side to side when holding it sideways; up and down angle isn't great but has not been an issue for us.
CONNECTIONS - I had no trouble at all with the connectors on this tablet, the micro USB and HDMI are very tight and go in easily but I am careful with EVERY micro-USB device, so be sure to take your time when plugging and unplugging them and they will last.

This tablet is worth more than the cost in my opinion, I have been showing it to people at my work who were quite impressed, I gladly referred them to this model because of the ability to stream movies and charge at the same time.

My daughter worked hard on several chores and extra duties to save enough money to spend on a budget tablet.  We decided we would chip in half to get her something nicer.  When we found a 10.1 inch tablet that seemed to get pretty good reviews, we thought we struck gold!  She was so excited!  When it finally arrived, she followed the instructions to charge the tablet for 10 hours.  Imagine the patience of an 11 year old to do that!  Then she finally got to power it on and use it.  Immediately, it had problems.  She had trouble loading games, and the game she loaded would glitch.  It kept giving a couple of error messages about google play.  I tried reading blogs about how to alleviate the problem, and thought maybe it was actually a software problem, so I factory reset it. The next day, my daughter tried using it again.  It froze.  She didn't know about the reset button on the top that you can use to power it off with a pin or tack.  So she waited for the battery to run down, then tried charging again for another 10 hours.  Then we factory reset again, and started over.  This time, I completed the initial steps to set up the tablet, and loaded a few games.  It seemed to work better, but games were still a little glitchy, and they would shut off in the middle of the game, or not start at all.  Tonight, I get home from work, and she shows me her tablet is frozen again.  I reset it.  It freezes again.  WE CAN'T USE THIS THING!!! So frustrating!  So, I told her we're sending it back.  This much frustration for three days with a tablet that freezes more than it functions properly isn't worth it.  My daughter is disappointed.

Maybe this one tablet we received is just a bad unit.  It seems others have had good experiences.  But based on this one tablet, I will never purchase a Dragon Touch, and probably not an off brand tablet at all.  We have had a few budget tablets, and all were far better than this one, but none of them were great.  This is bar far the worst piece of technology I've ever laid my hands on!

Sure, it's fine I suppose, but the viewing angle when tilting up and down is horrible. Also, the colors are certainly dry and not exactly eye popping. The resolution isn't the best either. If you can handle the rather unimpressive screen, this is an excellent all-purpose tablet well worth the price.

So this is a 10 inch tab for $100. Think about that. I had to lol. So:
- It's not a $300+ tablet
- The screen has good color, on the cool side which I prefer.
- The resolution is acceptable, movies and games look great on it.. Text and icons can look a little fuzzy.
- Screen is very responsive
- Viewing angles can be odd. Darker or lighter vs. the angle. You need to be deliberate with the angle you view it at.
- Fantastic brightness. I use this outside during the day.
- Battery life is great considering the brightness and size of the screen. Although I always have a portable battery pack to keep it charged up if I'm streaming.
- Streams perfectly, music and video.
-WiFi is as strong as my nexus tabs, and it is NOT difficult to get connected as other reviews have stated. This is the normal KitKat WiFi connection setup. KitKat was never good at hoping networks. Always turn WiFi off and back on AFTER switching networks.
- Bluetooth is kinda weak. Not as much range as my nexus tabs.
- Audio is pretty good. Exceeded my expectations considering some of the comments. It's louder then my nexus tabs, and it has rear firing speakers. Plenty loud and good quality to watch a movie outside. And of course it's going to sound better with a BT speaker.
- I think it's slightly under powered, though it runs smooth. Just not 100% of the time. Menus, scrolling, and animations don't lag, they just stutter a bit.
- Haven't played a ton of games yet. But the ones I have played run fine on it.
- Cameras, meh. But hey, a $100 10 inch tab has to cost save somewhere. It's got both a front and rear. The rear is decent.
- HDMI out is nice to have. Works great.
- Size and weight is nice in the hand, though the plastic case is slick. It's like a Samsung in that respect. Get a case.
- Haven't added memory to it so can't comment on that.
- GPS works exactly the same way as my nexus tabs, there has to be a network connection for it to work.

Imo, you really can't go wrong at this price. Mine is mostly for media consumption, but I find myself reaching for it more and more. I got it just to use outside... If I drop it, scratch it, who cares it was $100. After using it for a while, I would recommend this unit and I would buy another. The smaller tab would perfect for kids. I was very excited when I got this tablet but it seems to have a software issue and Amazon and manufacture have yet to assist me. The MAC address changes every time you reboot/restart the tablet which makes it impossible to connect to wifi. This is an excellent product, for the price. I have a couple of minor quibbles but this tablet has turned out to be better than expected. I recommend it, as long as you keep in mind you are not buying the latest iPad.

Pros: With 1 GB ram it's very fast, 16GB of ram is "roomy" and the touch screen is responsive. Watching TV/Movies has been flawless as has downloading and installing programs via a wireless connection. Battery life more than adequate (I'm using Avast battery saver) at, I'm guessing, 6-8 hours of my typical use of playing games, surfing the internet and streaming the occasional TV show.

I also give 5 stars for customer service from TabletExpress (see cons below).

Cons: First and foremost the screen "angle" can be unforgiving. Tilted correctly the screen resolution is excellent however, moving the tablet around will cause the display to fade somewhat and can be annoying but propped up it's fine. If you plan to wave it around a lot and have several people looking over your shoulder it's probably an issue but for personal use, not so much.

My major issue came when, after less than two weeks, the mini USB port broke. Obviously I wasn't able to recharge the tablet or do anything else so I contacted TabletExpress. Their response was immediate. I returned the defective tablet (at no cost to me) and received a new replacement in less than a week. I could not have expected a better response. With my new tablet I treat the USB port gingerly and hopefully i won't have a repeat.

Improving the display and more durable ports and it gets the 5th star.

If you need a inexpensive tablet and are willing to accept the screen shortcomings and treat that USB port gently you'll have a great buy. I don't regret my purchase at all and gladly recommend the Dragon Touch.

We decided on this tablet for several reasons and it has preformed as well as we wanted it to. We were looking for something to replace a DVD entertainment system in our SUV. It would be mounted using a suction mount tablet holder suctioned to the dome light. An IR transmitter would feed the audio to IR headphones on the kiddos, leaving the adults in blissful silence! Alternatively the FM adapter can play the audio through the Excursion speakers.
The tablet needed to included the following:
1. less than $100  - technically right at $100 but within the budget.
2. expandable - yes it does have this capability although it is labeled TF Card. Handled a 32 GB micro SD.
3. 3.5mm headphone jack  - handled the IR transmitter and the FM adapter both beautifully
4. 10.1" - the screen was large enough for kids in the back to easily view the movies. We were a little concerned with viewing angle but we didn't seem to have much issue. The tablet was mounted near the roof. The only problem came when the mount would slip and the tablet would tilt down. Otherwise the viewing angle worked very well for us.
5. decent battery life - we got 4 full movies at full screen brightness both going to our destination and coming home

We didn't need a super speedy tablet but this Dragon Touch is surprisingly powerful. It did a good job loading the few apps I put on and surfing web, facebook etc. It seems to be a pretty powerful tablet. We are pleased with it. It came with a screen protector already put on and it does have a few bubbles. But that's very minor in the grand scheme.

I am very pleased with the Dragon Touch A1X Plus.  The product quality exceeded my expectations, especially based on the purchase price. The unit is well made. The screen size/reolution and adjustable brightness are very good.  The onboard speakers and volume are much better than expected. The FM radio works great with earphones wire used as an antenna. APPS a plenty, and you can search for what you want and install them.  The processing speed,  memory and storage memory are more than adequate for most users.  I have ordered a 64GB micro SD card to be inserted for expanded storage.  First charge battery life was 6-1/2 hours with wifi active.
I recommend this unit for almost any user, especially those on a budget.  If you don't have a tablet - go for it and order yourself a Dragon Touch A1X Plus - you should be happy.
