Had to write this review from my phone. Tablet keeps freezing and restarting. Manufacture website is useless. No updates and have to call over seas to support. Don't waste your money!!!
Does just what it said it will do. The need to work on screen resolution as you have to be directly in-front of it to view it. It serves its purpose and the price is right.

The tablet is good if it works.  We bought two of these.  One had a problem taking the micro SD card.  The other one was freezing.  We sent both back and got two more that work great so far.  Good tablet for the price.  Just make sure to check it out when you get it.
Excellent product, very good quality better than expected
Great product for the price! Love it! Would recommend to others!
Love it
I have had the device about 5 days now and all is good.  Performing as expected with no issues thus far.

I have only had this tablet today, but am impressed so far. It is very responsive. Was easy to setup and use. Was packged very well. Overall, I am thrilled to finally have a tablet that I didn't have to pay an arm and a leg for.

I researched different tablets that were within a price range and this one was getting good reviews. So I bought it. Won't charge and won't turn on. Officially broke in a month. Don't waste your money on this. After it broke I went back to see what other reviews were saying and a lot more reviews started saying the same thing. This tablet was well taken care of and didn't last longer than a month. So now I'm back to researching tablets and this time around I'm going to spend more for one that is better known and will last longer than a month.

First of all, you can't beat the price. Secondly, it's a big screen, and being near-sighted and having big fingers that's a big-time plus. Great screen resolution that is comparable to my LCD HDTV. I highly recommend this.
Made a great gift for a mother-in-law. She is very pleased and uses it every day. Very good tablet for reasonable price.
Couldn't even see the screen.  Many bubbles in the screen too.  Waste of $$.  I bought a PumpkinX for $75 more and am delighted with it!

I replaced my Acer tablet with the Dragon Touch A1X Plus after it died suddenly one day.  I have not been disappointed. The A1X Plus is thin, lite and fast, all the the ports and buttons are located on the right side, making them easy to find and use. This is an amazing value for under a $100!
The product is equal to the more experience competitors and functions extremely well. Definitely will buy others for Christmas.

Screen scratches and cracks very easily. Once screen gets a small crack on it, it will not sense your touches at all. had to replace screen twice  from a foot high drop onto carpet. battery doesn't last long, and charger cord is cheaply built. I should have spent the $40 and got the Samsung.

The tablet worked great and performed as well as I anticipated. I was disappointed that it did not support multi-touch and the mic can not be used with headphones plugged in. Also after 5-6 weeks of use it began crashing from time to time, however this could have been due to the apps/games rather than the tablet. My big let down can after 3 months when the charging port broke. As such I do not recommend this tablet to others, there are 2 older Samsung Galaxy tabs regularly used by other family members in the house that and are still in full functional condition. I would recommend them to anyone looking.

The text resolution is horrible, it makes the tablet nearly impossible to use for any application that is text driven(word processing,bill paying,on line newspaper reading, etc.).  My 10 year olds $79, Apex tablet has better text readability.
Love it, works great, easy set up. Also great feature - has a HDMI. Very cool. Although it is a little rough to use in out doors situations. Low light is better.

I really enjoy this tablet. It was my first and I mostly use it to take notes in class and browse the web. One problem I have is that it constantly shows a 100% charge and when the battery starts running low it drops in percentage very fast. I usually don't notice the battery running low until I swipe on the pad and it hardly works when that happens. Other than that the charge lasts about 3 days of I use it constantly. The sound also starts with little pops but I don't use it much to listen to things so I can live with it.

For $99 Amazing!  I've had about everything under the sun.....this keeps up! Let's be real. . . Sound. . Display. . Ehhhhh. .. IT'S $99!  You want perfection go spend $200+  You want something quick that can handle what all others can, with ease and at 10"s..BUY THIS!
Great tablet for the price paid! Love it!
Tablet worth about half of what paid. continuously requires reset, battery indicator on top inaccurate, have to enter and leave email account twice before emails load
allright great price

I purchased the Dragon Touch AIX-PLUS in February. The sound was poor when compared to the Ipad but the screen was excellent. I have to say I was pleased with it until it slid out of the cover while on vacation. It fell about 1/2  foot onto carpet and shattered. The devise was still on but the keyboard would not work- had a heck of a time trying to turn the power off so I could board a plane. If it had not been so fragile I would have purchased another one but will try to find a sturdier version of it.

Just got this yesterday. So far it does everything my wifes nexus tablet does at alot less $$. I only gave it a 4 star because I can't get the voice recognition to work properly yet. I use it for news, music, e-mail, and e-books. This one has a 1 yr. warranty which was a big factor in my choice.
The second I turned on the tablet for the first time, the speakers made a loud cracking noise that I couldn't turn off. Defective. Returned.
My son love it!!

I got this tablet with my girlfriend as a birthday present for her mother who is in a rehab after her third hip surgery and was bored.  We were excited to give her a tablet to keep her entertained but had a few issues with it. The first tablet we received must have been defective because from day one, errors would pop up all over the screen when trying to download or open apps, the tablet would freeze or just turn itself off sudden or would just not respond or connect to internet at all.  We sent the old tablet back after only about two or three days and got a new one a few days later.  This new one seems to be working alright as of now, it is keeping her entertained so that is all that matters.

The tablet doesn't look bad.  Its a little heavy.  For now, it is very peppy, especially compared to a Nexus 7 running 5.1.1 (now a brick).  Unlike the nexus 7, this device cannot be used for two separate accounts.  I was considering using this table for displaying sheet music during performance, but the screen resolution is not good.  The angle of the screen has to be pretty weird for the screen to be clear.  Also the speakers and sound card are ridiculously bad.  Works great for reading tv guide, weather forecasts, recent news, twitter -  but that's about it.

So far it is performing well. It is lightweight and will be easy to carry. Just wanted to add that it was delivered on time and was just what we expected. I know it will make our computer experience the best. We are very happy with it. Thanks to amazon for having good suppliers.
I can dnowdoal GPS

I had a great buying experience, the product arrived just on time, as promised.
And the tablet is awesome, such a bargain for only $99.
You're supposed to charge it for 10 hours at the first charge. After that you're ready to use it, and it works great. Android is really the best operational system for tablets. I am 100% satisfied and recommend this product for everybody.
This tablet has the best cost/benefit relationship of the market.
Nice tablet, clean picture, much larger than expected.  No complaints so far.
Really nice tablet for the money.  The screen is bright and vibrant but a bit tough to see in full sun.  Would buy again.
Really fast shipping, arrived on a Sunday!!! Awesome product

Great design and user friendly interface. Great Father's Day gift for my husband! The only downside we could find to the product was that the resolution is not quite as clear as the iPad and there is a glare on the screen unless you hold it at just the right angle, however, these are definitely not things that would keep us from purchasing another if we wanted.

I am impressed with what this tablet can do. I am really pleased with it and hope that it lasts me a long time. Light weight and easy to use. Does good on gaming. Little bits of lag on MKX app but it may just be the app itself. Good product great price worth the buy!
nice for the money. Bought 2 of them. working great
Dragon Touch A1X Plus is exactly what I was looking for. It comes with all the necessary features that I needed. I was shipped quickly and very protected. I am extremely happy with the purchase.
This tablet is very clear.  Very easy to operate.  A lot nicer to work with than my phone.
Works well, really like it so far.
I received my order in a timely manner and just love using my new tablet.  It has a clear resolution and I love the ease of checking the site's I enjoy viewing.

It arrived late. Didn't work properly when I got it. Unable to access some apps. Others shut down randomly. After it taking for ever just to get a hold of these guys I exchanged it for a new one. The second one I got was not new and wouldn't even stay on long enough to get past question 2of the set up.  I asked for a refund. They said because it had been longer than 30 days since I bought it. So I exchanged it again. I had to pay the shipping.  The third one I got has about 2inches on one side of the screen that is non responsive. So I paid 100$ for a big headache and a piece of junk tablet. Will never buy from these guys again! Would give no stars if I could.
Good inexpensive tablet. Been wanting a larger tablet for browsing and reading. Fits the bill.
Very poor quality.  Tablet would not charge out of the box.  Returning unit to Amazon.  You get what you paid.

First off I am vary knowledgeable in the tech department. So when I seen this tablet I had to check it out. When I placed my order it took no time at all to arrive at my house. It was well packaged. I got it out and turned it on and it was already fully charged and ready to go. In 5 mins I was up and running. This tablet is vary well put together. It looks great and feels great. it is very responsive. The specs on it are real good for the price. I have a galaxy tab 4 and other then  the resolution on it being just a hair higher and you won't even notice . It is right up with that. But for a lot less in the price. I can tell you this tablet is worth it for sure. You won't be disappointed. I have gotten 3 other people to buy this tablet and they love it. If your even thinking about buying. Don't hesitate cause for the price you just can't beat it!!!

This tablet is a great value. When you consider several other brands out there, with similar features but at a higher price, this one stands out in quality. I own several tablets and count this one as a go to for reading Kindle books on a larger screen. I plan on purchasing another one of these as a backup.

So far, so good! As with many other reviews, I knew it was a lesser amount to pay so I was not expecting much. However, this little gem has been able to perform for me very well and I am looking forward to providing more feedback soon. So far, it has been able to help me present documents to clients, view movies both on its 10 inch screen and by attaching it to the TV via HDMI. Very Fast compared to what I had which was a refurbished ASUS.

As far as packaging and quality, everything came QUICK and CORRECT. I have found no blemishes or mars. I am very happy with my purchase and will likely increase to 5 stars when I update. I especially like the fact that I can charge it by hooking it to my computer. I could not do that before with the ASUS so that is a BIG bonus. I will have to read more to see if the chargers are interchangeable with my droid phone, but I am happy how things are so far!

7/6/15 UPDATE: I was able to charge with my Android Phone Charger so I am very happy about that.

Exactly what I have expected.
Pros:
- Inexpensive
- All the features I was looking for are there
Cons:
- Could have a better display quality
I love this tablet, traded a nexus 7 for this well worth it.
excellent tablet for the price

When I got the tablet I was impressed with the size and features of it, but the issue with the first one I received was that in the horizontal position if you tilted the screen even a 1/4" than the colors would change. Sent it back and ordered another thinking I just got a bad one, but the second one I ordered had the same issue. Unfortunately for me this is a deal break because while I could live with the lower screen resolution and bad colors the fact it kept changing the screen when holding it was too much of a distraction. Maybe I was unlucky and just got two bad screens but didn't want to try a 3rd one.

Just an update and I ordered Dragon Touch M10X instead which has a little higher screen resolution.

http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00VI2H5FM?psc=1&redirect=true&ref_=oh_aui_detailpage_o01_s00

This has all the same features as the other one, but none of the issues with the screen problems I had with the two A1X that I had to return. I would recommend spending the extra $40 and get this one instead.

I'm so disappointed... I purchased this 34 days ago and now conveniently 4 days after the return deadline it won't charge. :( my son is so sad because he has wanted a tablet for such a long time and now it's broken. I'm going to see if the carrier can help.
So far working great. Easy to use, beautiful  picture and sound not too bad. Perfect for what I needed a tablet for, watching movies and studying languages. Grateful for the low price.
burnt out in 31 days. makes a popping noise and shuts down. my father bought one also doing the same thing. RETURN ASAP! i went through loops for amazon to refund this because it was past 30 days.

This is a functional inexpensive tab, Books are easy to read on it, video playback is good and the quad core processor is up to all the tasks I have thrown at it, including some game play.  Don't expect it to look like an apple retina screen or some device that costs four times the price.  If you need a tablet and want a larger size this is a good buy for the buck but in quality it doesn't meet the standards of offerings that cost two times or more the price.

This tablet was defective straight out of the box, because it wouldn't charge and the power indicator was stuck. I tried plugging the tablet to my computer with the provided micro usb cable and that didn't work, and tried the wall charger that came with the tablet and that didn't work either. Even tried my own micro usb cable to plug it to my computer that I know for sure works, and that didn't work either. Also the battery indicator was stuck at 85% from the moment that I powered the tablet on till the moment it died. Pretty sure something was wrong with the micro usb port on the tablet or the battery itself, either way I am returning this junk and will warn others that they may want to drop more cash on a name brand tablet.
The tablet worked great for a few hours, except for the charging problem, until it died with the battery indicator stuck on 85%. You get what you pay for I guess.
Also, I tried to call tablet Express many times during the day that I got the tablet and kept getting the same answering machine message to call back later or to send them an email. I sent an email and never heard back from them.

This is a great tablet. If you are looking for a tablet and do not want to spend a small fortune, this is the one to buy. Lots of memory, great picture, and it is also great to read your favorite books on. It can hold many games also, if that is what you are interested in. I liked this tablet so much, that I bought one for my father for Father's Day so that he can play his casino games on it. Anything that you can download on a laptop, you can put on this tablet.
THIS IS AN AWESOME TABLET

This tablet isn't mine its myy mother's, I got it for her for mother's day. Based on the fact that she is rather new to android and it's her first tablet I wanted her use it because she wanted to, not because she felt like she had to because it was an overpriced big brand tablet. That being said, after an initial issue that was resolved, she loves it.

Pros: The tablet itsef is a VERY affordable 10 inch tablet that is powerful also. It has expandable memory and supports usb access through an adapter. The quad core processor clocked at 1.3ghz makes multitasking and loading apps a breeze. HDMI output makes connecting the tablet to a tv to watch youtube videoos in the living room a possibility and enjoyable.

Cons: The viewing angles are difficult at times due to the fact that they are very limited. The tablet suffers from lower sound quality, this is a real shame since the screen size offered could be used to watch netfix.

Side note: The first unit I recieved was defective and needed to be replaced, not that big of a deal but the time it took to complete the process was far longer than expected.

Final Thoughts: I believe its well worth the buy. The tablet more than exceeds its price point in value. while its not a tablet you're going to want to use to play the latest games, it will however handle pretty much everything else. I strongly recomend it to people whom want to get started with using a tablet, or a small business owner. It's size, power, and expandability could prove invaluable to a young startup, or a student.

This tablet is definitely good value for money. The screen has good resolution and it is much faster when using Wi-Fi than other tablets. It is easy to use and comes with many standard features that are not available on other tablets. I am 100% satisfied with my purchase.
Will not keep a charge, have to keep it plugged in to use.
Excelente for price, only one problem display
Couldn't download apps.
Sleek and beautiful.  Easy setup and Android powered, runs apps and streams videos flawlessly.  Very thin wirh a large screen. Graphics and display are great. Im very satisfied

For the money you cannot beat the deal of this tablet.  I paid less than 100 dollars for something that does what at least a 200 plus tablet can do.  I really don't care that it's not a well known brand but if they keep this up they will soon be up there with the likes of Samsung, etc.

The tablet has a good screen size, and decent speeds when running games. I didn't look at the screen resolution before purchase so it's a little grainier than I had anticipated but it is workable (coming from phone galaxy note 3 very noticeable difference). The tablet runs youtube quickly, and runs games with slight choppyness (Tested on Monument valley).
Battery says it needs to be charged right away but mine came fully charged so this was not necessary.
Make sure to remove the protective film as it may interfere with tablet use.
I did a quick test of the camera and while it is not a horrible camera I would not recommend it for a substitution to a standard camera.
I have not tried anything such as skype but I assume the front facing camera would provide a good experience for this type of application

So happy with this. I was apprehensive of buying what seemed like an "off-brand" at a very discounted price. I've been using it for almost a week now, and it's significantly faster than I expected it would be, very responsive, and well built. VERY pleased. I can see myself buying another one of these as long as it holds out over the long run.

Has some minor issues, battery charging is a bit odd, sometimes when you charge it powered off, it just keep flashing an empty battery symbol periodically and it doesn't actually charge; except when its charged when powered on. It isn't Samsung quality for certain. However, for the price its not terribly bad if you can live a few quirks.

I am disappointed in this product. I ordered and received the tablet in February and I am writing this review in June
- four months after purchase. The only complaint I had was that the sound seemed a bit tinny.  But considering the price to my mind, that was no big deal. The tablet performed fine until earlier this week.  BUT this week I tried to connect the electric cord to charge the tablet. The connection between the cord and the tablet is so loose that I can't get the tablet to charge. It seems to me that that the amount of money spent for this tablet was a bit pricey for it to stop working so soon.

Terrible tablet. Started with little quirks- randomly turning off when you touch the screen, not downloading apps. Slowly progressed to losing apps that were downloaded. Then moved to do statly s***ting down on its own in the middle of using it, will not download apps, or update built in apps, will not stay on for more than a couple minutes before s***ting off. This whole problem started 2 weeks ago,and now I am 5 days past being able to return it and it will not even stay on. For a hundred bucks, it should at least stay on so you can read your email.
Works well so far. Easy to set up. Buttons are fragile, easy to get stuck.
Great price for the tablet!  I had to flash the memory after a week, but that wasn't too hard.  Works great now!

First few days were fine and thought I had found the magical $100 tablet that could stream Netflix and I could read the Kindle App on. That lasted maybe a week before the micro-USB power input stopped working properly. It now takes about 4 full days to charge the tablet 50%, which is the max it'll go. I think it might be a physical issue as the connection feels extremely loose.

You get what you pay for. Dammit.
Wow. Received it, charged it, and sending it back. It doesn't hold the WiFi connection for more than a minute, even though my modem is 3 feet from me.
really impressed with tablet
Better than expected!!
Returned
Love this product. You can't beat a tablet with these features at this price. I would recommend highly!!!!
Screen angle is a minor issue but the tablet works great and have no issues for the 4 months I have used it.

Great look and feel in the hands, relatively new Android version, good wires for charging and connecting to usd included. I'm very satisfied. I did see 3 tiny air bubbles under the pre installed screen protector however they were very small, could be pushed out, and is covered by the tablet case by Finite (Fintie Dragon Touch A1X Plus/ A1X/ A1 10.1" Case - Folio Premium Vegan Leather Cover with Stylus Holder for Dragon Touch A1X Plus/ A1X/ A1 10.1-Inch Android Tablet - Black ) that I had purchased along with this which was also great.

I really like this tablet but unfortunately I dropped it on its side and it cracked the screen and no longer works. When it worked though was a pretty good tablet for the money. Light weight and really like the large screen. I used it mostly to stream movies and TV programs. Has plenty of space for games and apps, added music too. I miss my tablet so I will probably buy another one before too long.
Screen had a dead spot right out of the box.

This tablet lasted for about two months and had to retire. The battery life was getting progressively shorter until the battery would get completely used up from 100% charged in about 20 minutes with an airplane mode and all possible battery saving features turned on. Everything else was good - it had fast processor, good amount of storage space, the games ran smooth and without issues, and wifi signal was never a problem. Finally, the plug for charging cable got loose inside, so that the metal piece doesn't press on the plug to give it contact, which is making it impossible to charge again, and so it needs to get recycled.

I asked my brother whom I bought this for his birthday how he liked this tablet being the first one he got for his birthday died within the first 2 months he had it.  He just shook his head. What I said.  He said it quit working.  I said give it back and I will return it.  He said no not bothering with them anymore I gave it away.  So needless to say I am not happy with this purchase either since he hasn't had this one very long.  So I would not recommend getting one.  I don't know what it is about tablets but they don't seem to want to last long of at all. Mine is the same way.
For the money, this is a fantastic tablet.  The screen is fairly response and is very light.  I have tested most of the features and they are all functional.  I'm very happy with my purchase!
Just received the Dragon Touch tablet and am pleased with the speed and ease of set up. If all continues to go well, may buy a second

The tablet was great for the money except the screen. The screen had to be at a certain angle to be seen. The slightest tilt too far forward or back and you couldn't see a thing. I really had high hopes but the screen is just horrible!
This thing is awesome !! It's exactly like my android turbo which made it so easy to use and play with and I bought the thing for my wife for her birthday .

I bought this for my 8 year-old daughter. I set it up and tested it out with Netflix before giving it to her. The tablet operated very well. One thing, I got hung up the first time using Google Play and had to restart the tablet, but we have had no other problems. My daughter had no problem finding apps and installing them. The games like Fruit Ninja and Temple Run work very well.

The Good: Full-featured tablet can do everything needed, stream movies, play games with fast graphics, and play music.

The Bad: The screen's viewing angle is narrow, which is a bit annoying for me trying to look over my daughter's shoulder. She does not seem to mind. The camera is not the highest quality.

Overall: This tablet is the best value I have seen.

Do not listen too these reviews. It's absolute garbage. The same feel is so full it might as well be black in white and if you turn it the slightest direction the screen fades and you can't see a thing. I'm not kidding. My moms tracphone which is as basic as it gets has a better screen than this. And it's an absolute lie. It has no GPS. it's a really old model that they updated the Android software on and are trying too market it as a 2015 tablet. Im begging anyone considering too buy this not too buy it because I  don't want them too feel the crushing, depressing, stomach dropping dissapointment I felt when I was so exstatic that it arrived and powered up and realized I had just been fooled by the product description and reviews into spending over $100.00 for a giant screen equivalent of a 2004 flip phone with no GPS and and 2010 tablet operating system.

Got this tablet for my 3 year old daughter...she uses it for netflix and playing games here and there...everything on it works perfectly...I was even able to screen cast from the tablet to my amazon tv fire...playing angry birds on the big screen while controlling it from the tablet is pretty awesome...don't expect this thing to beat out a Samsung tab but just for basic stuff it's great
Love it!!
Bright,clear,picture.far better picture than most tablets.

Yes, I do love this tablet!  I've had it for 2 weeks and am very happy with it.
I have an android phone (5" screen) and when I went to google play, after signing in, it showed all my apps so was very easy to set this up.
I play several games and use the tablet for facebook as well as reading kindle books.  Like a big kindle fire but the cost is much less.
Overall, I think this is a great tablet,  It charges quickly and seems to hold a charge quite well.  I bought a cover/case for it that is one that Amazon sells that is made for the AIX Pus.  I didn't think I needed a keyboard - the on screen keyboard is fine for me and I wanted the cover for protection.

I love it!!!  Large screen with great resolution, fast wifi, camera ok.  The magicjack app is great I can call anyone in the US for free w/wifi.  Games load fairly quick and great time playing them!!  Great price, awesome.  It was delivered in great condition..

Great cheap and awesome
Okay so technically the only reason why I got was to use a a monitor for  my little home theatre pc  but from saying you can imagine how powerful this little thing I even was able to use to mirror my gaming rig on it  so was able to play to GTA V on  but as for the device its self very well built nice feel to it although the screen is very fragile do not drop at all or be forced to pay $40 to have repaired

When I first got this tablet I loved it,it worked well and charged well.now just only four months later it is ready for the trash can. This unit will no longer hold a charge nor will it even charge. It would start to charge then it will wipe out the charge and would not charge up completely, it would get to 30% then I would look at it again it was showing 5%. It was like it was charging itself then using the charge. I turned the unit completely off so it could charge,this still did not work. The unit now will not charge at all and it is completely dead,not able to be used anymore. I will never buy this product again. I am turned from a very happy customer to a very disappointed customer. Thank you
I love this tablet. You get a lot for the price
its good but i had 1 for less then 30 days and the charger inside the tablet broke. Amazon gave me a refund so I got the same one again. lets see how long I can make this one last.
I bought two. Having to send one back. I suspect there is a problem with the sound card. But otherwise OK.
First one came cracked but they quickly replaced it. My daughter loves it! Would buy again.
this was a very good value and we like it alot

I love this tablet and will love it even more if it does not lock up on me!  TableExpress works with me and wanting to make me happy, that's a big plus... I use it for church and love when others are watching use this tablet. Thanks...Deborah Nance

It's an OK tablet for the price but be aware, if you like to use the tablet for reading things like books and other applications where its use is predominately in portrait format, this tablet is TERRIBLE. It is obviously designed for use in landscape because when you turn the tablet to the portrait orientation, a slight twist to the right renders the screen completely unreadable. I really can't understand why they would design it like this.  Also, be aware the screen is very wide and not tall. If you're used to traditional ~4:3 ratio tablets (this tablet is ~2:1), this will seem different. I found that the android keyboard will take up most of the screen when typing in landscape.
Reading books and magazines etc is the reason I bought it and because I can't use it for that purpose is the reason for my one star rating. If you never plan on using it in portrait mode, it may be a good deal for you.
Very sensitive works well

I just received Dragon Plus and tried to call number with question got voice mail saying would call me back within 48hrs what kind of service is this??? otherwise I think a very good product I if I ever get a  call back user manual very poor

This is a great deal for the money. The only problem that I have is that the camera does not take great pictures. At times they're not even recognizable images. if this is something you plan to use for videoing or taking pictures,then I would suggest another product. but it's excellent for traveling w h end needing to use the internet and emailing.

This is a good value for a family tablet.  I surf the web on it and my son plays games.  I am no expert but it seems plenty fast enough for our uses -- I mean what do you expect for such a good price?  I like that it has google play installed because it makes it easy to find all kinds of android apps.  I am just about to download the MS Word app.  I got a case with a plug in keyboard and that makes it easy to do work on as well.

I like the big size of the screen and it is good for viewing you tube videos and they seem to load and buffer well.

Personally, I like the white case and I think this tablet looks like a much more expensive item.

I have had this tablet for a little over a week now and everything works great so far. Good screen quality, I like that the charger is  like a mini usb, verses the other kind they have being just a little "pin" plug in. I have no complaints so far so good!

After setting it up, the instruction manual does have some inconsistency, as others have indicated in their reviews. power adapter that came with mine was in fact a USB-style, not the older DC pole-style port, which is displayed in the manual.  Setup and charging was a breeze. The screen is low quality but the price you can't beat.

I give this five stars because I am looking at this tablet at a price vs performance angle. You wanna compare this to other $99 dollar tablets and start bashing it the list gets really short. But compare it to $200+ dollar tablets and sure, you're gonna have arguments. But remember! You just paid double or even triple what this costs. So you really can't compare the two.
  I am coming from a Dell Venue 8 tablet. For a reputable company the tablet from dell was just awful. This tablet has been such a stress reliever to use compared to that one. First things first. People, this tablet is only $99. Think about that for a min. The only other competitors I've found in that range for what you get are RCA, NextBook, and maybe Sero. I did  a lot of research and I decided to go with this tablet. So far I am very happy with my purchase. I try to remind myself that I was going for my best "bang for my buck" quality. Once again, I only spent $99 on this thing. Anything else close to what this is offering is well over the $200 range. Sure you have the Nook HD+. But have fun with the Barnes and Noble locked down OS, unless you wanna spend the time to root that thing. This comes with KitKat OS right out the box. The setup was way easy and so far it's been flying while I use my apps and stream content on it. For $99 I am pretty pleased so far.

OK the Cons. Like others have mentioned.
- The resolution is lower than other tablets. I knew that going in and I was willing to sacrifice that for the price.
- The speakers/sound are not as good as some others. Compared to what? a $200+ dollar tablet? Yes, that's why you just paid double for that tablet. That is the hit you take on price vs. performance and quality. You'll need to think about that(same for the resolution).
- The overall look and plastic casing is not exactly expensive looking. Yes. This is a cheaper tablet. I personally don't care to much about looks. I go for hardware and performance vs price. This gets the job done very, very well in that area.

And that's it so far. I say, "so far" because I don't want to state absolutes. Perhaps something will go wrong in the near future. We'll see. But for now I have really enjoyed this tablet for what I paid. I've never heard anyone ever try to compare a Porsche to a Toyota or Honda. That's how I feel about this tablet. Toyota and Honda are reliable and work. But not always pretty or the best performing. That is why a Porsche or other sports car of that caliber will cost you twice as much. It's not hard to understand really. I say go for it if you are looking for the best "bang for your buck" tablet. You have a small budget but want the best out of that budget. This is a great option for a budget tablet. Period.

I love playing Android games, unfortunately my current smart phone (android 4.4) has a screen (5") that makes it very difficult for a gaming junkie who started playing in the 80's (C64).  Yes my eyes are old and my fingers numbish...

So I went on Amazon to price my first Pad - imagine my surprise when I found a Pad with 4x the screen area of my phone for less than $100.  Ordered, waited two days, and it was on the step!  My findings after 4 days!

Meets my primary goal 100% - like playing on a super sized phone!  I can even peck the right letters with the Dragon Touch.

Haven't explored all the features but here are some observations:

Plays games with the same responsiveness as my phone ++++
Screen visibility is good, sensitive to viewing angle + (for the price actually expected much much worse)
Set up was easy - no more difficult than on my phone (completed basic startup and e-mail in about 30 mins) ++
Battery life good ++
Documentation shows a non-standard charger, actually has a mini USB!!! (of course I will use the provided charger until warranty period expires) :)  ++
App Availability AWESOME! +++
Productivity - why would I need this?  But I found Polaris Office and it would meet any needs I have -really need a mouse and dedicated keyboard for productivity though.
Camera is not so great, haven't tried Skype yet because I won't use it for that
Browser is actually better than phone - tabs provided like IE ++
Youtube video is good, you get the resolution you paid for plus a little better +
1 year warranty, it was less than $100, do I really want to pay for extended - NO

So down to my only real negative -
WiFi range is very limited, my wireless router hits 10+ devices throughout my house.  The pad loses connection at about half that range. Since I travel a bunch waiting to see how that affects my hotel stays.  Other than this fact I'd be giving out 5 stars.

BTW - looks good against my wife's fruit pad at 15% of the price!

Chuck M.

I will update if I find anything additional
Very good tablet for the money

Cons: Some times slow in responding to the touch of screen. There is some bugs need to be fixed: the camera image is upside down in certain app's video call such as WeChat, and the voice call in the app is not in good quality.

Downloads are quick(about 135mb/s on my 150mb/s wireless ntwk.). Wireless range is very good but a little fussy about where you put hands on the unit when downloading (I just lay it down). Screen resolution, processor speed, apps...everything is far above what you would expect at this price point. The unit is very thin and light. I get about 5 hours on a charge (depending on settings) without wifi running. I can't find anything to complain about...my teen age grands like it better than their iPads. Mom picked it up and used it without any questions or prompting-and she hates electronics anything so it's got to get points for intuitive interface and function. Highly recommended.

Screen quality is low, inspection quality is also low, makes me wonder if anyone even inspects these at all.

Screen has bubbles in it, and no this screen thingy is glued on. Cannot remove it. Cannot fix it. Have to take it to a professional or send it back.

I have worked with electronics all my life and I have a problem with anything that gets scratched from touching it in a way it is meant to be touched. Considering this is built and designed around having a touch screen, the pads of my fingers should not scratch it. It is very prudent anyone get a screen protector before you so much as touch the screen at all, if you are a person reading this review looking to buy this tablet. Mine has superficial scratches all across it from simple, light touches its supposed to be made to handle. I would also like to point out, screen covers are also not supposed to get scratches from that, no matter how superficial.

Otherwise, I like it. However, whoever makes this needs to keep design quality in mind, especially with how important the screen is on something that is designed around having a touch screen. Screen protectors are supposed to be optional(there to protect against other things besides the pads of your fingers or a stylus made for it) not necessary because it scratches from simply light touches with the pads of your fingers. It is supposed to take a lot more than that to scratch something. For me, this is a huge issue, because this is a very basic design/manufacturing flaw with a basic part of things, because I cannot stress how necessary screen quality is on something built around the fact you are going to be touching it or using some sort of stylus to be touching it.

And if your going to put two of these 'screen covers' on it... it really needs to be done better. Their aren't supposed to be bubbles in it. As it is, we are both irritated that we will have to save up and take it to a professional. Both of us are pretty strict about the care of our electronics. This is after all a household where I grew up building computers and he went to college for computers. Otherwise... yeah. Not amused. I am more than aware how cheap the material it is made out of is and how fragile the design is. I feel almost as if I could break it in half if I put too much pressure on it, and I probably could too. With this thickness, it shouldn't feel like that but I can accept that. We both knew it was a cheap tablet. We expected that at least.

Won't be traveling with it until I get a case for it, I am pretty strict about that and my fiancee is damn near religious with putting his tablet in his case when he isn't using it out once... . I like the bigger screen, its perfect for drawing and doing digital art on it. The only adaption is that most of the apps won't let me use the stylus. The screen barely registers the softest one I have because its smaller and the apps register specifics touches or types of touches. Around the edges no touch registers at all, and some parts of the screen towards the edges only register touch some of the time or partially or simply not at all. If the screen wasn't such an issue I would have called this perfect for doing digital art work and easier(and neater) than carrying around a sketch book or a lap top.

 I suppose that has up sides and down sides depending on what you want to use it for, but I feel it is a design flaw when you have tot ouch it but touching it scratches it.

I have tested the tablet in several capacities so it is more than OK for the price otherwise. It has good processing speed, a good amount of memory, and is overall really good for a lot of things, gaming included. If you have the apps for it, I would say yes for multimedia as well(provided your willing to take care of the screen issues either ahead of time or afterwards) I just feel the screen is a big enough issue to dock it that much for, because really on something that is based around having a touch screen that is a pretty big problem. I also feel as if, if I drop it it will shatter. On the up side I am all the more careful with it... however I would not recommend this tablet for children. Too fragile. I know a lot of people let their kids play with the tablets, for this one if you do I would say either watching videos not letting the kid touch it or set it on a flat surface after getting a special case and a screen protector for it, have them lay it flat. What can I say... I believe if you have electronics you should take care of them and if you are going to be letting kids touch this tablet at all, it will need a little extra so it doesn't break the first time its dropped. Always assume kids will drop something, that is the safest way to go for the kid and for whatever they are going to drop, also safer for your wallet too.

Anyway, it is a very good tablet, it simply has some issues with the screen and some cautionary things if you want to hand this to your child to play with.

Otherwise, It is quite a good tablet.

----

Edit, apparently their was a fracture in the glass I did not see under the black. It expanded across the screen, with some smaller ones from the same place it apparently had either when it was shipped or got during shipping. I called around and most places don't fix dragon tablets and it would cost as much as we paid for it to fix it because they want the same rate they would normally charge to fix it even if I get a new screen to fix it, it is a fix minute fix. Our only option is to send it in and hope they replace it with one that doesn't arrive already damaged, the next time I will have to feel for anything I can in that area of the tablet. I had assumed that area was supposed to feel like that and did not realize it wasn't until it cracked as it did.

One good point I did not mention before is 'app permission'. The tablet lets you manage them, disallow things you don't want as they happen. For instance, my sketch app doesn't need to know my location. It tells me when an app is trying to get into my personal information or things like my location and lets me decide wreather I want it to do that. In america they don't make tablets that do that. I like it, I prefer it. I will endure the excessively fragile screen to have it even though it is a major hardware flaw. The software is also better than most tablets here that don't cost an arm and a leg in price, in other words you don't have to be rich or have saved up a ton of money to get it. It is still quite a price... but most people can afford 99 dollars for something they can keep. I would not recommend it for traveling though, the screen is fragile.

I would also maybe advise amazon stop shipping through the US postal service because the US postal service while some of the mail people are nice... often doesn't know the meaning of the word 'fragile'. Not saying they literally don't know what it means... but the way they sort things and whatnot... often things get banged around so even if it wasn't shipped out broken, it is likely sometimes to arrive broken. So either it wasn't packed right or what... but the customer still wants the tablet or any other product they order unscathed. We were also a bit disappointed that when using paid shipping it arrived almost the same day it would have if we had not paid for shipping.

It looks as if the only way for us to handle this is to send it back and try to get a new one that doesn't have anything broken.

I will say, the bubbles on the screen have nothing to do with shipping.

I only know because well... if it isn't already broken... I would like for it to arrive as unbroken as I would like them to send. I still don't know how it would have gotten that sort of fracture from shipping though. It seems unlikely it was anything but an error from the company it was received from. Just saying.

I bought this tablet for my 76 year old mother, who found it easy to use. She found it easier to type on the screen than with the keyboard cover that I purchased for her. There is a free cover that the company thoughtfully provides, after a product review is submitted by the customer. I will switch the cover for her to that one because the keyboard cover that I purchased is not responsive to keystrokes and is not user friendly.

The 10 inch screen is roomy for watching movies and entertaining her with mahjong apps.

I like the tactile feel of the screen, when zooming in or out. It does not feel fragile.

I like the cameras. Skype would be a convenient option. The cameras take decent still photos and can also do movies, although I still have not tried this function.

Have explained to my mother that an earphone plugged into the tablet acts as an FM radio. Neat! I'm not sure that she will use that much, however.

I like the card expansion slot for memory a lot and wish my Kindle Fire HDX had one, too. The Kindle Fire HDX also lacks an outer facing camera. It does have one facing the user. Kindle has no FM radio capability.

The A1X-Plus is heavier, but that goes with the larger screen. I like it better for surfing the web than the Kindle because of the size.

It is an excellent value for the money.

I thought my tablet was done for, but I found a forum saying to plug in the charger for a few minutes and then hold the power button down for about a minute. Eventually came back on with all my data still on it. Hoping it will last a few more months and will update my review as needed.
very nice unit great price from swest1@netzero.net  order #113-8154453-6050622

I have just received my Dragon Touch A1X Plus, and so far, I have no complaints. It arrived fully charged; it was incredibly simple to set up to my exact specifications; it has a high volume, making it easy to watch videos and movies; all my applications load very quickly, including YouTube videos, which all play in HD.

All in all, as of right now, I love this tablet, and I hope it continues to live up to my expectations.

EDIT: Okay, after about a month and a half of using this tablet, I am having trouble with charging it. I have used several different Android device chargers, but the port has, in my brother's words, "come loose". Now, I still love this tablet, but I am wondering if I can fix the port problem. Should I send it back?

I will be returning this tablet. For one thing I do not believe it was new. It already had a 98% charge and Portugues language set on it. I have not tried all the features but the one that does not work, is use of a stylus. I can not use one on the tablet. Finger touch works but sometimes you have to add so much pressure and tapping more. This should not be necessary.

when I first started looking for another tablet I thought it was going to be a heavy tablet because of its size, but, guess what? it is very light for its size, the colors are amazing,both cameras, the front and rear HD camera are really good, sound is up there with the costlier tablets, I do not want to toot my own horn, but, I made a good purchase!!!!!!
This is not a bad tablet (for $99). If I had paid more I would not be very happy. If you are used to the image quality of a high-end smart phone, you will likely be disappointed.

Good tablet for the price.  Bought one for my mother and a second for a friend.  First one to my mother had a broken screen, but was refunded and another was ordered on the same day.  The one for my friend arrived in perfect working order.  Both are very pleased, and mom is looking forward to being able to video chat with her new tablet.  This is my second review.
Very happy with the dragon touch tablet

Anyway, product is everything described. I love it, and when it comes time to upgrade, I will definitely purchase this brand from this buyer, again!
Worth every penny! If you are on a limited budget, I highly recommend this product!

Excellent tablet recommend.

June UPDATE
I still like it BUT...........these past few days I have to come in and stand in front of the wireless router to get a book to open or move in the apps....not sure if that is a problem with the android or the dragon touch.  I hope this will not be a daily thing having to come into the office to open an app....
I read all the reviews and because I am not in the habit of "listening" to anything on my current "tablet-Kindle Fire" I was not to concerned about the sound.  Sound IS very tin box sounding, but it is OK. that is the only reason I did not give it a 5 star rating.
This tablet is actually very nice for the money.  I do a daily Bible study using the Dragon and the large screen is perfect for my aging eyes!!!
The ease of moving around took me a day+ to learn but I am not computer savvy and I was used to my Kindle, however once I got used to where to find things all was fine.
ONLY problem I found was my gmail came over with no problems, but my hotmail said I had new messages but I could not see them, I went into settings and for some reason my hotmail was listed as a "corporate" account (probably by me??) and once I changed that now my hotmail emails come over just fine!
I would recommend it for someone who does not require perfect sound, perfect picture and lots of storage.....works great for someone like me
just wanting to read on a larger screen!!!
I would really recommend this unit for anyone who wants to read on a larger screen at a reasonable price.

I am still searching to find how to keep the screen lit longer, without any use it seems to go dark after maybe 10 minutes? but that is not much of a problem so  I am not rushing to figure out what to do.
Worked for five days an stopped

I have had this tablet for a couple of weeks and it performs well. For those used to screen quality of cellphones (or Samsung tablets), this is a budget priced device and you get what you pay for.

I bought this to keep in my kitchen so I wouldn't have cookbooks or printed recipes strewn all over. I didn't want to pay a lot for a tablet that I was planning to use only in the kitchen and this does well for that. I have it mounted under my kitchen cabinet using the highly recommended CTS mount (https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00I4I92C2/ref=oh_aui_detailpage_o03_s00?ie=UTF8&psc=1). I primarily use the "Paprika" app for recipes

The viewing angle is not great but I am generally looking right at it or can swivel my under counter mount to get the right viewing angle. Again this is a budget priced tablet.

I have not tested the battery life because I plan to leave it plugged in.

BEWARE, this device does not have "Gorilla Glass" and will scratch if you aren't careful. I recommend some kind of screen protection.

Tablet Express's implementation of Kitkat is a little clunky so I installed the "GO Launcher" user interface, which I use on my S4 and the "Swiftkey Keyboard" because it has arrow keys to make it easier to navigate when I'm typing.

The FM radio feature is a bonus. You need headphones plugged in to use as the antenna so it will work but you can have the sound work through either headphones or internal speakers (my choice). I have an old pair of headphones with the earpieces cut off plugged in with the wires taped to the back.

I gave one star b/c of the picture quality. If you can't see clear, you can't use it. Viewing angles of the screen are horrid, even looking directly at it there seems to be trouble viewing the screen. It looks so grainy and dull I would go blind from daily use of this tablet. I almost got sick just by looking the screen for so long. If seller can fix that problem, i probably buy it again.

This tablet it a work horse for sure. I think for the price paid it was a very good deal. It has the specs to get work done and bluetooth is a nice bonus for me (using it to connect to my car and watch stats). The only thing that I feel should have been mentioned by other reviewers is that the sound quality is terrible. Like I dropped my jaw when i heard it. Don't even try using the tablets speakers and if you have a decent pair of headphones don't go over half volume as the tablet either has no amp or has a terrible one. all in all I would be another one if this one broke but don't expect much from it as far as sound goes. (to be fair I'm somewhat of a snob when it comes to audio. Headphones will allow you to listen to music and such be honestly don't us the tablets speaker...ever...at all...seriously.)
it came with the os installed and no junk apks that cant uninstall works perfect :)

Bought two for my older relatives to learn to use the tablet. It's easy to use, quality of video and sound are perfect, the resolution is good, the speed is amazing, and it's very well built for the price. The only downside is the room has to be well lit to use the camera properly. Other than that, it'd say it's a really good deal.

very easy to use, love the graphics, love the battery life when gaming, love the accessories that come with it, the ports that a lot of tablets don't have, and converters that come with.. the ability to use my jump drive with it and sd card and hdmi really make this the best tablet i've bought, and for the price you wouldn't expect as much as you get!

I am extremely disappointed with this tablet. First when I turned it on, the font format was so broken , and bad, that I thought this tablet has been developed years ago. The quality of graphics is very ppor. I turned the Tv app. on this tablet, and my godness colors were badly saturated. Love it.  Plays video, songs, Internet Access, Reads books... what else can you ask for?  Our household owns three.

I received the Dragon A1X plus quad core tablet ahead of its shipping due date. When I opened the package which was well protected for shipping I was impressed by it construction. It was not flimsy or light weight. It was sturdy. It appears to be well assembled. It was larger than the 8 inch tablet that I had been using and it took awhile to get used to handling it. Also when I assembled it into the keyboard case it appears to be almost like a mini 10 inch laptop which makes it a lot easier to use. My hands are small so using it as a tablet can be difficult when typing or using the touch screen, so I am ordering a hand holder for this unit. It will also be useful when my young friend comes over and wants to use it to play games. He has small hands. It will be easier  for him to play when he has the tablet hand holder. Also when I first turned on the dragon touch it was very easy to set up the system and set up the wi-fi connection to connect to the internet, less then 5 minutes. I gave it a 4 star rating but if it stands the test of time I would raise that to 5 stars based on the price I paid for itbonus point it takes a micro 64 MB memory card for additional storage capacity.

So far this tablet is working great except for one issue.  If the table is turned on while still plugged into the wall outlet then the screen is messed up.  There are not any icons it is just green and brown bars over the entire screen.  It then needs to be reset.  If you unplug the tablet then turn it on there is not an issue.

Update:  The apps stopped working and reset did not solve the problem.  Returned item.

I had to update my review.  The first time I bought this, I got a lemon.  Amazon was AMAZING with the return. They SENT UPS to my HOUES the NEXT BUSINESS DAY & picked it up at no cost.  UPS even printed the return label for me so all I had to do is hand them the box!

Amazon has been blowing my mind lately. The customer service is outstanding!  Way easier than buying it from Walmart or whatnot.  I've had top notch experiences on Amazon for the past 15 yrs.  At Walmart, if you want to return something, you have to wait in line & deal with questionable customer service reps.  Not with Amazon.  So easy & smooth!  No feeling of "risk" when I buy on here.  Love it.

Now, aside from that, the Dragon Touch A1X does run pretty fast. The screen resolution is pretty good, but it's a $100 tablet so you can't expect super high res.  Not bad, though.  I like it.  When you play back video, it looks fantastic, though. And I was able to read all the fonts & everything.

Screen is very bright (except used near sunlight).  I bought a $12 keyboard/case that essentially turned my Dragon Touch into a $100 laptop.  Can't complain!

It's worth noting that the screen only looks good when you look at it from certain ideal angles.  Not a huge deal, but something to consider.  In a way, that's nice for privacy, because if someone looks from over your shoulder or from the side of you, they won't see your screen as well as they would on some other devices!  The screen looks clear looked at straight on when holding it vertically like a smartphone.  And when you put it in the aforementioned optional keyboard case accessory (not included), the angle tends to be ideal & the screen looks great when used in "laptop" mode.

The battery lasts FOREVER.  I swear I've left that thing unplugged for a week at a time without having to charge it.  VERY pleased!!  With my phone, if I don't remember to charge it before I go somewhere, I'm in trouble & have to remember to grab a charger before I leave the house.  Not with the Dragon Touch.  The battery lasts super long.  In fact, I don't think I've ever gotten a "low battery" notification since I've owned it.  VERY rare among my devices!!  Love that!!

Almost all laptops, phones and tablets have terrible sound quality from the built-in speakers.  No exception here.  But you can always connect it to earbuds, headphones, bluetooth speaker or use a Y-cord (Stereo RCA male to 1/8" male) to plug it into a stereo, to get good sound.  No problem, but just so you know.  Definitely get a speaker, some earbuds/headphones and/or a Y-cord if you want to watch videos or play music on this (or anything else involving a need for good quality sound).

Takeaway?  It's not a Galaxy Tab but for the money, it's a great value.  Honestly, I can't believe you can get a quad core tablet that works this well for this low of a price.  I love it and would recommend it & buy it again.  Very pleased and pleasantly surprised.

Also, I'm enthralled by Amazon Prime, Amazon's return policy, the lowest prices and best value in the world, plus an amazing customer service experience every time I've called.  Even when you have a problem, they treat you like a king & speak clearly!

I will be an Amazon customer for life, no question.  I hardly go to the store anymore except for groceries or to window shop!!

Good budget tablet. The 10.1" size allows plenty of room to comfortably read and browse online. As an entry-level tablet, you can't go wrong with this price point. I purchased this Dragon Touch to use with my students. The larger screen and portability open up lots of great possibilities.

One thing I didn't realize is that Adobe Flash is no longer supported by Android, which means no video or games on anything requiring Flash. There are some workarounds to load outdated Flash, but those old versions can be hit-or-miss. The Flash issue is a general one common to all Android devices (so I gather). A couple particulars about my specific Dragon Touch:
- About the middle of the touch screen, it seems to lose sensitivity, so if you're dragging across the screen, it stops tracking and treats it as if you released whatever you were dragging. This also carries over to the virtual keyboard, as letters in that area can take a few taps to register.
- Around the edges of the tablet, I can see small air bubbles where the front screen is not fully secured to the body of the tablet.

The touch screen might get better with time (maybe there was some imperfection on the screen surface that will smooth over with use), and the edges of the front screen don't seem to affect functionality. For the price, I can't complain too much about some manufacturing faults.
Had some random difficulties a week into using it, but the seller was very helpful and we got it working again after a few troubleshooting suggestions! Great tablet!
Very responsive. Very happy with my purchase so far.
Great tablet for the price, I have installed a lot of APPs and all of them work without any issues at all, recommended.

I am quite pleased with this product. The tablet has a large screen, making it more enjoyable to play games and watch tv shows/movies on. While the screen is not HD, it is still clear and entirely functional. The only problem I have experienced with it is the touch screen got a little too sensitive- to the point where typing on the keypad became a problem because letters that you were not even touching were being picked up by the screen. However, this problem seemed to have rectified itself after rebooting the tablet, and I have not had it come up again since. I would very likely recommend this tablet to my friends, especially for its price point.

I know its been said already. If you want a tablet with big time performance, you need to pay big money.  This is not going to keep up with an iPad or Samsung tablet. For $100, its a pretty good deal.

You get a large screen with good, but not great resolution.  It has two speakers right next to eachother, but I discovered it actually sounds better if you cover one up (I used electrical tape). It uses a micro usb slot for both charging and transferring files. You will also find a micro sd card slot, which the manufacturer says can take up to 32gb cards. There's a 3.5 mm headphone jack and finally a mini hdmi slot. Make sure you get a mini hdmi adapter and not a micro hdmi. It also comes with an AC micro usb charger.

The tablet performs well streaming video, its a little laggy playing games compared to my kindle fire hd.  Battery life is ok.  I streamed tv shows for about 3 hours from a full charge, and still had 30 or 40%.  The battery indicator is pretty wonky though.  It will drop from 100 to 90 in a few minutes. Then it drops at a pretty slow pace until 48 where it will stay for a long time. After that you have to watch it pretty close.  The battery starts dropping from 48 eventually. It will drop at a faster pace until about 30 percent. At this point, you need to plug it in because the indicator drops like a rock and will hit zero in a few minutes. At least that's what happened, and still happens with mine.

The biggest problem I have with this tablet is Wifi and bluetooth connectivity.  It takes more effort than it should to connect this to Wifi. The Wifi range is not very good. My house it about 900 square ft, and basically square in shape. My router is in the middle of the house and the tablet has a pretty poor connection anywhere but in the living room.  The bluetooth is even worse. The tablet will lose connection if it is turned the wrong direction or you put a wall or door in between you and the bluetooth device.
.
Taking into account these problems, I still love this tablet.  It has Android 4.4.2 Kit Kat. You have full access to the Google Play store. This is a big leg up on my kindle fire hd as the Play Store has many more apps than the Amazon App store. It is pretty light weight and there are plenty of accessories available for it. It comes very nicely packaged in a foam padded box.

Over all, you get a good product for the money. As long as your expectations are reasonable, you shouldn't be disappointed.  If you don't want to drop 400 or 500 dollars, the Dragon Touch A1X Plus is a good cheap alternative.

I've had this tablet for about 3 months and it's already essentially dead - it has a short somewhere and only charged 10% in three hours, and when on, even when plugged in, it loses power.  I can also only get it to charge at all by basically tapping the charger in place at just the right angle.

Before this problem, I was very happy with it - for the price it was definitely a good value, I used it pretty much primarily for Netflix and Youtube and was happy with the speed and image quality.
It's so good and light that I gave my mom my old iPad, no exaggeration.

I bought the Dragon Touch A1X in May 2015 for my wife.  She has been very happy with the table, so much that I decided to purchase one for myself to replace my Nextbook8.  I consider this well above a budget tablet and would recommend it to anyone looking to purchase a tablet at a low price.

The only drawback I have found is the Kitkat 4.4.2 operating system does not allow write access to the external SD card.

Previous purchase:
I bought this tablet as a replacement for an under-performing RCA tablet.  Start up was simple and within 20 minutes my non-tech wife was up and running.  She will use this tablet mainly for internet browsing and social media, so the requirements are not overly demanding.  With 1GB RAM and 16GB Nand Flash, adding a 32GB micro-SD card was a bit of over-kill, but works good as back up  memory.

Another thing I noticed is the Dragon Touch A1X was not pre-loaded with excessive unnecessary apps. On previous tablets have required a lot of app clean-up at start up.

The built-in Bluetooth, GPS, HDMI and Dual Camera are also nice features to have on the tablet.

Also, after a bad experience with another tablet manufacturer who would not support their product after 30 days, I was happy to see Dragon has a full 1 YEAR defect warranty.

All-in-all the Dragon Touch A1X 10.1" Quad Core is a great tablet for the price.

OMG... LOVE LOVE LOVE THIS! now to be 100% honest, I was a little skeptical about getting a 10" tablet for under a hundred bucks, my co workers have iPads and my hubby has a Samsung Tab. I had purchased the Dragon Touch 8" tabs for my daughters and they adore them, so I figured I am the ONLY one in my house without a tablet, it was my turn. I got my Tab yesterday and I haven't put it down yet! (I am writing my review on it now!!) the instructions said to chrge it before first use, but it came 100% charged, my battery (over 24 hours later and a ton of usage) is still over 50% charged. my Hubby asked if I wanted to trade tablets!
Now we all know there are bound to be some issues with a less expensive item... while I stand by my statement that this is a Quality product, I will say that it does have some issues that are to be expected because of the lower price point. When you hold the tablet and press the back, you can see the ripples on the screen. you don't even really have to press the back, just the action of touching the touch screen is enough to press it onto your fingertips on the back of the case to cause the ripples.
second, because the speakers are on the back of the tablet, the sound is not as loud as I would like for it to be on a tablet, but for a $100 Quality piece of technology, I can buy external speakers or figure out how to get the sound amplified.
third, and I don't know if this is just because I am used to the speed of my personalized laptop, but it is a little slow in loading pages. I figure I need to learn patience and it isn't dial up slow, just not lightening fast.
A more positive feature to end this review... the HDMI connection is a TOTAL bonus. my husband likes to review photos on the big screen so not everyone is gathered around a tablet screen so to be able to connect the tablet to the TV is a Great addition.
also, I almost forgot, I purchased the 64 gig SD card to increase my holding potential and it doesnt have a single issue with it.
if you are looking for a Quality tablet at a more than reasonable price, I HIGHLY reccommend this tablet!

Bought this exactly 3 months ago.  only used it ~15 times or so.  Was working "fine" (well, minus the continued message of 'google-play has stopped working or not responding'; besides, apps freezing up during shows). Used it last night and went to use it after having it plugged in overnight, and no power, nothing on the screen. Seems like it just "died". Have no idea what happened. Did nothing to cause it shut off/ fail/ malfunction/ die.  It was a nice convenience, while it lasted.  (Jeez, 3 months? not impressed).  "You get what you pay for" is the quote of the day.
Great product -- large screen, very user-friendly!

Very nice graphics and excellent touch pad capability. This was my second try with 5he tablet. My only major/minor issue is that calls to customer service go directly to voicemail.  Not very handy if there is an issue that needs timely resolution.

The tablet has great features for the price. That is why I am rating it 2 stars. Unfortunately it can not be used. The screen is EXTREMELY bright.  It actually hurts your eyes. I turned it down to the lowest setting and it was still too bright. I am not sure how anyone rated it higher than 2 stars. I understand that it is a budget tablet, but if it can't be used, then it is a waste of money at any cost. Maybe I received a defective one. I returned it for a refund. Amazon was great as usual. I will be purchasing a mid price tablet.

Great inexpensive tablet. Very easy setup. Very crisp graphics for the price. Great speed with the quad core processor. I highly recommend this tablet for all users. I can't believe the speed of the delivery of this product! One day! Way to go Amazon!!!

I bought this primarily to read books and comic books on and for that it performs perfectly. I like that I have the option to do more if desired. The screen is bright and clear although viewing it from an angle blacks it out, but why would I do that anyway? A 10.1" quad processor tablet with Android 4.4, 16GB of storage and 1GB of memory with the ability to expand storage for only $100 is a fantastic deal. You don't need the top tier stuff that cost from $340 to $700 in most cases.

One thing I like about Android, and this specific tablet is that it uses a standard connector and you can just plug it into your PC and copy data back and forth without having to install any 3rd party software. That is always a plus for me.
Love the bigger screen. Crystal clear screen/display. Great device to take on long trips! My only qualm is the power bottom is on the bottom and I have accidentally turned it off holding it.

Okay maybe I was expecting too much.  This has a lot of features for the money but it also has some things which you need to know before you buy it. The one big feature it has which I don't like is the plastic screen.  I removed the screen protector because it shows the slightest scuff marks from just normal use.  Thinking the screen would be glass I removed the screen protector and learned the hard way the plastic screen is not much better than the screen protector.  So it is live with the scuff marks from just normal use or find a screen protector which I can live with. The performance is above average to average.  Expect a slight to a little more than a slight delay after you tap on something before it responds.  Also the screen requires you view it pretty much straight on which I do most of the time so it's not too big of a deal. So as the saying goes you get what you pay for.
I am now able to play games with my husband and keep all of my job stuff all in one place.  I am very happy with this product and would recommend it to anyone.

First off, I haven't had much experience with an Android tablet, so the learning curve is still there.

That said, I have to say I truly like this tablet.  It's fun and portable.  It means much to me for the portability, I don't have to lug my heavy laptop around.  Streaming videos is clear and sharply defined (I use Netflix and Amazon Prime). I can't say much about games, as I only play casual
games.

As for the battery life: I watched 2 episode of "Bones" , played a couple of casual games,  Fooled aroud with Play Store and installed a few storage eating apps. Messed around on the web and dealt with some emails. I still had time with my battery if I wanted to do some more stuff on the android.

What really got me was the Customer Service at TabletExpress.  They were prompt and are currently helpng me with a technical problem.  They didn't tell me to go to the manufacturer, or give me a go-around.

Like other people who wrote reviews: I also have some screen issues.  Ther are very fine scratches on the screen, don't know if I put them there or the cover I bought did it.

 For a budget android this is the place to go and get it.  I recommend it to children and us old folk. (And to anyone in the middle.)

The viewing angle does significantly affect visibility, but the low weight makes holding it straight easier than heavier 10+" tablets, effectively mitigating that problem. Because the touch screen seems to have more friction than others I've used, I suggest using a smooth stylus rather than fingers.

Pleasantly surprised by the quality and performance of this device, being realistic knowing the specs for a tablet at this price point.  I used to own a Galaxy Tab 10 and apart from the big difference in screen resolution, this Dragon tablet performs with the same responsiveness as my Galaxy.

I like it but the resolution could be better everything is blurry.other than that it good.

This device is very slow sometimes. I thought it was the sensitivity of the screen that has me tapping things too many times to make them work, but it is the operating system. It does not allow Sandisk Micro SD's to work directly from the package, as all of my other devices will, but this device forces formatting the MSD itself (apparently to Fat 32). (Had to replace the first purchase of a Dragon Touch as that one did not  recognize the MSD.) So, although copying to an MSD from my PC or phone is lightenig quick (1.5gb to an originally formatted MSD out of the package takes seconds), the newly formatted Fat 32 MSD on my PC takes about 13 minutes. So, the time investment copying to accommodate this device is often a nuisance. Therefore, I also cannot effectively run some of the same apps my phone runs, e.g., my phone runs MiltiPic allowing in seconds for me to switch out about 25,000 pictures (some very large) or just have them all rotate automatically, but this device has me limit the size of the picture folder to about 250MB to effectively see them.

There were plenty of benefits, so I decided to keep it for the price, and am sorry now. It has no problem running ripped HD movies (still works), the sound distributed to speakers/headphones is great (hard connect only now), I used to watch Cox Go apps for CNN, Fox, ESPN, NBCs live app, until it stopped connecting with routers. The wifi feature ony finds my phone now, which turns this into a travel only tablet (if I can call it that any longer) that only burns my data. The FM radio feature is really cool (does not require a web connect). The screen size, vividness of the screen are fine, but big wow with all the other downsides.

Finally Bluetooth deteriorated to nearly nol working. BT initially found only some of the devices my phone easily finds, i.e., I have a device that makes any speakers bluetooth, but this Dragon Touch is the only device I have that will not find it (and this Dragon Touch failed and still fails with several BT devices). So, the GPS feature in conjunction with my phone via Bluetooth worked great for a month. This Dragon Touch used to find my phone with BT and now does not.

TIP: The $12+ keyboard / leathercase that Amazon suggests is a good investment if the device keeps working well for you. Another reviewer shows how the back of the tablet can be sturdier with the keyboard accessory. Until there is a case / board that allows the stand to be adjustable, cant think of a better complementary accessory.

works great stay away fom 7 88 though but the ax1 is a great tab for the price
